attributes.background: Start a permanent reforestation scheme of planting locally appropriate tree species across the UK in all public owned spaces & incentivise planting on private land. Establish a panel of experts to recommend operational measures. Nominate a Gov't department to design and implement the scheme.
attributes.additional_details: Long term local and global  benefit of large scale diverse tree planting include: Improvement in quality of life for all, climate change prevention, creation of habitats for all wildlife, better air quality, prevention of flooding, a healthier population, prevention of loss of habitats and soil erosion and job creation. It is unethical to disregard this as it would be cheap and reasonable to start a scheme that could have a diverse and profound impact for the greater public good.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Create a Task Force to support residents displaced by environmental events
attributes.background: Due to climate change, flooding and coastal soil erosion within the UK are becoming more common, in some place resulting in displacement of residents. The UK Government, therefore, needs to create a task force to mitigate the mental health impact climate change has on these people.
attributes.additional_details:
The Task Force should be given responsibility for the following:
 
- Providing access to support for mental health issues faced by displaced people.
- Providing access to economic support.
- Developing and implementing community-based solutions such as support groups and job resettlement schemes.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Establish mandatory buffer zones of a minimum of 10 metres,next to watercourses.
attributes.background: Our rivers and streams are part of our National Infrastructure. River and stream margins protect our rivers and streams, store water, clean water, provide important habitat for our wildlife and store carbon. Many of our margins are lost through agriculture and development.
attributes.additional_details:
Development on floodplains is a prime cause of catastrophic flooding.
Soil erosion from fields cost the taxpayer £150million per year (Cranfield University 2009) Margins stop the soil leaving the fields.
The mandatory buffer zones will reduce the run-off into rivers of pesticides and fertilisers used in agriculture.
 Wilder river and stream corridors created through mandatory buffer zones  will reduce flooding, reduce pollution, capture carbon, help biodiversity, help business and help people

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about development near watercourses, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition calls for "buffer zones", but doesn't say what these should involve.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
